result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandolyn A. Charles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
No credit if revoked from Probation.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: With Huber all stayed pending further order of the Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandolyn A. Charles

records.addlTxt:
2:46 PM cases 22CF753, 22CF834 called and held via Zoom. Defendant Brandolyn A. Charles appeared by video.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for Brandolyn A. Charles.  Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties. 
Defendant acknowledges prior convictions and pleads No Contest to Count 1 as charged in the criminal complaint in 22CF753 and Count 1 as charged in the criminal complaint in 22CF834. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Defendant is advised of elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court finds defendant Guilty and orders anything else dismissed and read in. Defense makes a statement before sentencing. 
Defendant makes a statement before sentencing. 
Court withholds sentencing and places the defendant on Probation for 24 months with conditions: 
120 days in Jail with Huber all Stayed pending further order of the Court. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant has 3 days credit in 22CF834 if revoked from Probation. 
Defendant has no credit in 22CF753 if revoked from Probation.
See plea hearing for details as to the waiver of preliminary hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 11, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Order on Request to Appear Remotely
The Court Orders: Brandolyn Charles may appear remotely for the proceeding scheduled on 10/11/2022 at 2:45 p.m.
Proposed Order on Request to Appear Remotely
Plea hearing on September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on October 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
